    R=
ickard> state, not commands?  And if so, won't that have
    Rickard> maint=
enance and security problems (e.g. malicious clients
    Rickard> posting s=
tates that are invalid from a domain point of
    Rickard> view)?

Clients =
hold the state, that's correct. Obviously you can store state on
the server=
 on behalf of the client, but the interaction with the server
is determined=
 by the client which must know what it is doing.

It's the server's duty to=
 reject invalid commands down from invalid
verbs to invalid queries, state =
changes, etc.

So I don't see that "maintenance and security" problem. You =
always have
to validate external input, the web is no different.
